meanings.definition: To become stale or lose freshness.
meanings.sent1: Leaving bread out for too long can result in it staling quickly.
meanings.sent2: The cookies started staling after a few days on the counter.
meanings.sent3: The race against time to eat the cake before it starts staling was on!
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project began staling as the days passed.
meanings.sent5: The flowers wilted, staling in the summer heat.

meanings.sent1: The staling of the bread was evident by its hard crust.
meanings.sent2: Staling can be slowed down by proper storage of baked goods.
meanings.sent3: The staling of the chips turned them into crunchy snacks.
meanings.sent4: The staling of the air in the room made it stuffy and unpleasant.
meanings.sent5: The staling of the water in the glass left a ring of residue.

meanings.definition: The act of making something stale.
meanings.sent1: The staling of the cake was intentional for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: His experiment involved the staling of various foods.
meanings.sent3: She joked about her staling of the chips to play a prank.
meanings.sent4: The staling of the bread was necessary for the stuffing to work.
meanings.sent5: The staling of the crackers was part of the aging process for the cheese.
